intro: Ophiorrhiza dolichophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf marsh bean, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. Ophiorrhiza dolichophylla plays a role in stabilizing coastal and swamp ecosystems due to its extensive root network.
